line_1: Now so happy, now so gay,
line_2: 'Tis for — this my lay.

line_1: 'Tis for — this my lay.
line_2: Now so happy, now so gay,

line_1: While the nymphs with pleasure twine,
line_2: With each flower that decks the spring,

line_1: With each flower that decks the spring,
line_2: While the nymphs with pleasure twine,

line_1: The gay garland for the brow,
line_2: Few amongst them sweet as you;

line_1: Few amongst them sweet as you;
line_2: The gay garland for the brow,

line_1: May the nymph for him design'd,
line_2: Ever faithful, ever kind;

line_1: Ever faithful, ever kind;
line_2: May the nymph for him design'd,

line_1: Sweet and chearful, may she be;
line_2: Temper and good sense like thee.

line_1: Temper and good sense like thee.
line_2: Sweet and chearful, may she be;

line_1: IN shades! to pass the summer day
line_2: In Spring — to see the lambkins play,

line_1: In Spring — to see the lambkins play,
line_2: IN shades! to pass the summer day

line_1: In each returning — season find
line_2: New beauties to amuse my mind,

line_1: New beauties to amuse my mind,
line_2: In each returning — season find

line_1: No morning ray! no setting fun,
line_2: No painted sky — shall be unsung,

line_1: No painted sky — shall be unsung,
line_2: No morning ray! no setting fun,

line_1: The gayest seat — adorn'd with art,
line_2: Or fields — or meads — their sweets impart,

line_1: Or fields — or meads — their sweets impart,
line_2: The gayest seat — adorn'd with art,

line_1: The peaceful cottage — in the glen,
line_2: With trees — around — and crystal well,

line_1: With trees — around — and crystal well,
line_2: The peaceful cottage — in the glen,

line_1: All these — with equal mind I view.
line_2: From heaven descend the rains — and dew.

line_1: From heaven descend the rains — and dew.
line_2: All these — with equal mind I view.

line_1: Were in my choice to take,
line_2: But only for thy sake.

line_1: But only for thy sake.
line_2: Were in my choice to take,

line_1: That Stella I would be;
line_2: Or keep a swain like thee.

line_1: Or keep a swain like thee.
line_2: That Stella I would be;

line_1: A stranger as thou art;
line_2: Alone to gain thy heart.

line_1: Alone to gain thy heart.
line_2: A stranger as thou art;

line_1: Would Stella thought like me?
line_2: Would Stella told it thee.

line_1: Would Stella told it thee.
line_2: Would Stella thought like me?

line_1: My name thou ne'er shalt know;
line_2: I can thy love forego.

line_1: I can thy love forego.
line_2: My name thou ne'er shalt know;

line_1: I mind each word he spake;
line_2: I'll keep it for his sake.

line_1: I'll keep it for his sake.
line_2: I mind each word he spake;

line_1: Or, if you think of me,
line_2: If that's approv'd by thee.

line_1: If that's approv'd by thee.
line_2: Or, if you think of me,

line_1: As far as I could see;
line_2: The rustic swains to me?

line_1: The rustic swains to me?
line_2: As far as I could see;

line_1: Polite attention pay;
line_2: Nor vain neglect essay.

line_1: Nor vain neglect essay.
line_2: Polite attention pay;

line_1: May catch a Flavia's eyes;
line_2: Alone can Stella please.

line_1: Alone can Stella please.
line_2: May catch a Flavia's eyes;

line_1: NOT death so common, or an infant lost,
line_2: The turn of mind by tender feelings tost;

line_1: The turn of mind by tender feelings tost;
line_2: NOT death so common, or an infant lost,

line_1: Deep by regret each happy scene reflect,
line_2: For her my life all other joys neglect.

line_1: For her my life all other joys neglect.
line_2: Deep by regret each happy scene reflect,

line_1: Blows there a rose so sweet? each flower recals —
line_2: A day how gay, then droops its head and falls.

line_1: A day how gay, then droops its head and falls.
line_2: Blows there a rose so sweet? each flower recals —

line_1: Bleak winter comes! the lifeless trees no shade,
line_2: A dreary night; how cold, how chang'd a bed!

line_1: A dreary night; how cold, how chang'd a bed!
line_2: Bleak winter comes! the lifeless trees no shade,

line_1: How then to sleep, to peace, my mind compose!
line_2: At once depriv'd for ever of repose.

line_1: At once depriv'd for ever of repose.
line_2: How then to sleep, to peace, my mind compose!

line_1: What have I done? to blast my early hope,
line_2: Torn thus my life, the cause of my hard lot?

line_1: Torn thus my life, the cause of my hard lot?
line_2: What have I done? to blast my early hope,

line_1: Oh! awful thought, to question thy decree!
line_2: Prostrate to earth, my spirit flies to thee;

line_1: Prostrate to earth, my spirit flies to thee;
line_2: Oh! awful thought, to question thy decree!

line_1: The mystic dove in clouds ascends above,
line_2: Come, little children, come, and share my love.

line_1: Come, little children, come, and share my love.
line_2: The mystic dove in clouds ascends above,

line_1: Around her couch in innocence descend,
line_2: Thy guardian wings to comfort and defend.

line_1: Thy guardian wings to comfort and defend.
line_2: Around her couch in innocence descend,

line_1: Resign'd her mind, in slumbers quiet impart
line_2: Thy heavenly scenes to raise again her heart.

line_1: Thy heavenly scenes to raise again her heart.
line_2: Resign'd her mind, in slumbers quiet impart

line_1: But how these scenes, these joys, conceiv'd below?
line_2: For aught in earth would I these scenes forego,

line_1: For aught in earth would I these scenes forego,
line_2: But how these scenes, these joys, conceiv'd below?

line_1: Already blest, yet wants one blessing more,
line_2: When we shall meet, and you these scenes explore.

line_1: When we shall meet, and you these scenes explore.
line_2: Already blest, yet wants one blessing more,

line_1: PRoud thus to wait, — each colour to prepare,
line_2: But wants the art — to paint the blooming fair.

line_1: But wants the art — to paint the blooming fair.
line_2: PRoud thus to wait, — each colour to prepare,

line_1: Around her neck, in innocence she smiles,
line_2: And fondly — hides herself in infant wiles.

line_1: And fondly — hides herself in infant wiles.
line_2: Around her neck, in innocence she smiles,

line_1: The maid obsequious — scarcely in her arms,
line_2: Restrains the babe — her slender hold alarms.

line_1: Restrains the babe — her slender hold alarms.
line_2: The maid obsequious — scarcely in her arms,

line_1: Choose then this groupe, dispos'd by softest shades
line_2: And playful win them to their evening beds.

line_1: And playful win them to their evening beds.
line_2: Choose then this groupe, dispos'd by softest shades

line_1: But how the mind — the mother to express?
line_2: Who fondly folds her infant to her breast.

line_1: Who fondly folds her infant to her breast.
line_2: But how the mind — the mother to express?

line_1: A vain attempt — a figure far too fine —
line_2: A Raphael's hand could scarcely trace each line.

line_1: A Raphael's hand could scarcely trace each line.
line_2: A vain attempt — a figure far too fine —

line_1: Steal fancy lightly — scarce the curtain by,
line_2: Nor breathe while sleep — the babes in slumber lie;

line_1: Nor breathe while sleep — the babes in slumber lie;
line_2: Steal fancy lightly — scarce the curtain by,

line_1: To the first cause let innocence my mind.
line_2: How moves the babe? — who forms the human kind.

line_1: How moves the babe? — who forms the human kind.
line_2: To the first cause let innocence my mind.

line_1: They wake — the light — how joyfully he gues,
line_2: While fancy hovers as the two she views,

line_1: While fancy hovers as the two she views,
line_2: They wake — the light — how joyfully he gues,

line_1: WITH cautious care, each virtue, trembling claim,
line_2: Perform each duty that can raise thy name.

line_1: Perform each duty that can raise thy name.
line_2: WITH cautious care, each virtue, trembling claim,

line_1: Thy alms bestow, thy prayers in public pay,
line_2: Restrain thy tongue, each passion must obey.

line_1: Restrain thy tongue, each passion must obey.
line_2: Thy alms bestow, thy prayers in public pay,

line_1: Weep to a friend, the reigning sins lament,
line_2: And, pitying, hate a beauty that can paint.

line_1: And, pitying, hate a beauty that can paint.
line_2: Weep to a friend, the reigning sins lament,

line_1: Thy faith maintain with controverted strife,
line_2: Nor, panting, yield what ye've imbib'd with life.

line_1: Nor, panting, yield what ye've imbib'd with life.
line_2: Thy faith maintain with controverted strife,

line_1: All meek again — so humble — and so fair,
line_2: Sure so much goodness must be Heav'n's own care;

line_1: Sure so much goodness must be Heav'n's own care;
line_2: All meek again — so humble — and so fair,

line_1: That breast, no gall, no wormwood ever knows,
line_2: Till — enter beauty — brighter than the rose,

line_1: Till — enter beauty — brighter than the rose,
line_2: That breast, no gall, no wormwood ever knows,

line_1: No sly disguise her faults to cover o'er,
line_2: No mean applause the purport of her soul;

line_1: No mean applause the purport of her soul;
line_2: No sly disguise her faults to cover o'er,

line_1: From higher views her mind benevolence shade,
line_2: The social virtues hand in hand are led.

line_1: The social virtues hand in hand are led.
line_2: From higher views her mind benevolence shade,

line_1: Modest though knowing brightens on your hand,
line_2: And as she brightens, Envy cannot stand.

line_1: And as she brightens, Envy cannot stand.

line_1: As night retires at break or dawn of light,
line_2: Let Falsehood vanish — Truth shine out more bright.
